1.text: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? Or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

2.text: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? Or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

3.text: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young, They cast out their fruit.

4.text: Their young ones wax strong, they grow up in the open field; They go forth, and return not again.

5.text: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? Or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

6.text: Whose house I have made the wilderness, And the salt land his dwelling-place.

7.text: He scorneth the tumult of the city, Neither heareth he the shoutings of the driver.

8.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, And he searcheth after every green thing.

9.text: Will the wild-ox be willing to serve thee? Or will he abide by thy crib?

10.text: Canst thou bind the wild-ox with his band in the furrow? Or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

11.text: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? Or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

12.text: Wilt thou rely on him, that he will bring home thy seed, And gather the corn of thy threshing-floor?

13.text: The wing of the ostrich beateth joyously; But are her pinions and feathers the kindly stork’s?

14.text: For she leaveth her eggs on the earth, And warmeth them in dust,

15.text: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, Or that the wild beast may trample them.

16.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as if they were not hers; Though her labour be in vain, she is without fear;

17.text: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, Neither hath He imparted to her understanding.

18.text: When the time cometh, she raiseth her wings on high, And scorneth the horse and his rider.

19.text: Hast thou given the horse his strength? Hast thou clothed his neck with fierceness?

20.text: Hast thou made him to leap as a locust? The glory of his snorting is terrible.

21.text: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength; He goeth out to meet the clash of arms.

22.text: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; Neither turneth he back from the sword.

23.text: The quiver rattleth upon him, The glittering spear and the javelin.

24.text: He swalloweth the ground with storm and rage; Neither believeth he that it is the voice of the horn.

25.text: As oft as he heareth the horn he saith: ‘Ha, ha!’ And he smelleth the battle afar off, The thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

26.text: Doth the hawk soar by thy wisdom, And stretch her wings toward the south?

27.text: Doth the vulture mount up at thy command, And make her nest on high?

28.text: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, Upon the crag of the rock, and the stronghold.

29.text: From thence she spieth out the prey; Her eyes behold it afar off.

30.text: Her young ones also suck up blood; And where the slain are, there is she.
